Issues.Title: fix(core): address Trusted Types bug in Chrome 83
Issues.Body:
In Chrome 83 passing a TrustedScript to eval just returns the
TrustedScript back without evaluating it, causing the
newTrustedFunctionFor{Dev,JIT} functions to fail. This is a browser bug
that has been fixed in Chrome 84, and only affects Angular applications
running with JIT (which includes unit tests).

As a temporary workaround for users still on Chrome 83, detect when this
occurs in the newTrustedFunctionFor* functions and fall back to the
straightforward, non-Trusted Types compatible implementation. The only
combination that is left affected consists of Angular applications
running with JIT, that have explicitly configured Trusted Types in
enforcement mode, with users that are still on Chrome 83.

Also correct docstring for newTrustedFunctionForJIT.

Issues.Title: check that param names in JsDoc match actual parameter names
Issues.Body:
I think the Angular project should add/implement some rule to check that param names in JsDoc match actual parameter names.
This rule should fail a build if it finds the problems.
For example this could be done by adding lint rules (see the plugin https://github.com/gajus/eslint-plugin-jsdoc).

**Goal**: is to protect from issues like https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/40746

Issues.Title: fix(docs-infra): several style fixes for angular.io
Issues.Body:
Several style fixes for angular.io:
fix(docs-infra): clear unneeded DOM nodes in `CodeExample/TabsComponent` (click to expand)
Both `CodeExampleComponent` and `CodeTabsComponent` components receive some code via content projection, glab the projected content and pass it through to a `CodeComponent` instance for formatting and displaying. Previously, the projected content was kept in the DOM (hidden). This unnecessarily increased the number of DOM nodes. This commit fixes this by clearing the projected DOM nodes once their content has been captured.
---
fix(docs-infra): fix vertical alignment of contributor info items (click to expand)
This commit fixes the vertical alignment of info items (i.e. links to bio, Twitter, website) in the contributor list. _**Before:**_

_**After:**_

---
fix(docs-infra): dim line-numbers in code examples (click to expand)
This commit ensures that the line-numbers in code examples appear "dimmed" to make it clearer that they are not part of the actual code. Based on the CSS rules, it seems that the intention was to make it so, but the color was incorrectly set on the `
    ` elements instead of targeting `li::marker`. _**Before:**_

    _**After:**_

---
fix(docs-infra): fix search results top padding when a notification is visible (click to expand)
Previously, when a notification was visible at the top of the page, the search results pane had more top padding than necessary. This commit fixes it by removing the extra padding. _**Before:**_

_**After:**_

---
fix(docs-infra): avoid page-breaks inside an image when printing (click to expand)
Previously, when printing, a page-break could be inserted inside an image (contained in a `.lightbox` element). This commit ensures no page-breaks are inserted inside `.lightbox` elements (which contain images). _**Before:**_

_**After:**_

---
fix(docs-infra): improve line-spacing between search results (esp. for wrapped lines) (click to expand)
Previously, the line-spacing between different search result itemswas the same as that between wrapped lines of the same result. This made it diffucult to distinguish the different results. This commit fixes it by reducing the line-spacing between wrapped lines of the same result item and keeping a larger line-spacing between different results. _**Before:**_

_**After:**_

---
fix(docs-infra): fix sidenav top position on narrow screens (click to expand)
On larger screens the top-bar has a height of 64px. On screens smaller than 600px, the top-bar has a height of 56px. As a result, the sidenav should have a top position of 56px on screens smaller than 600px and 64px on other screens. Previously, the style setting the top position to 56px was tied to the presense of the `.collapsed` class, which depends on whether the sidenav is docked or not. The change from docked to collapsed sidenav, however, happens at 992px. As a result, e sidenav had an incorrect top possition (56px instead of 64px) on screens between 600px and 991px. This commit fixes this by ensuring the change of the top position for the sidenav happens at 600px.
---
fix(docs-infra): improve line-spacing between TOC items (esp. for wrapped lines) cClick to expand)
Previously, the line-spacing between different TOC items was almost the same as that between wrapped lines of the same item. This made it more diffucult to distinguish the different items. This commit fixes this by reducing the line-spacing between wrapped lines of the same item and keeping a larger line-spacing between different items. _**Before:**_

_**After:**_

---
fix(docs-infra): fix placement of TOC hover/active markers (dots) (click to expand)
This commit fixes the placement of the TOC hover/active markers (dots) so that they are horizontally in the middle of the marker "rail" and vertically in the middle of the first item line. This commit also refactor the `_toc.scss` to be more DRY (wrt ot styling the TOC markers/marker rail) and uses Sass variables and mixins to ensure that the styling is kept up-to-date wrt to future typography changes to TOC items. _**Before:**_

_**After:**_

---
fix(docs-infra): fix top padding of main content when a notification is visible (click to expand)
This commit fixes the top padding of the main content on the homepage and other pages when a notification is visible at the top of the page. The problem was particularly obvious on the homepage (see images below). _**Before:**_

_**After:**_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(docs-infra): several style fixes for angular.io" (#40802)

Issues.Title: HttpParams does erroneous URL Encoding
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/common/http; concretely using the HttpParams API ### Is this a regression? I do not know ### Description This is what I was trying to do: `cardData` holds a base64 encoded payload. ```typescript private getAnnualReceiptPdfBlob(cardData: string, receiptId: string): Observable { const queryParams = new HttpParams().append('cardData', cardData).append('receiptId', receiptId); const apiCall = `${environment.API_BASE_PATH}/api/Reading/receipt`; return this.httpClient.get(apiCall, { responseType: 'blob', params: queryParams }); } ``` With this, the backend was not able to successfully decode the payload. If I did the codification myself like below, then it works: ```typescript private getAnnualReceiptPdfBlob(cardData: string, receiptId: string): Observable { const apiCall = `${environment.API_BASE_PATH}/api/Reading/receipt`; const queryParams = `?receiptId=${receiptId}&cardData=${encodeURIComponent(cardData)}`; return this.httpClient.get(`${apiCall}${queryParams}`, { responseType: 'blob' }); } ``` ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction I cannot provide "samples" because the cardData holds sensitive information. But it's a base64 encoded string ## üî• Exception or Error No errors, just a 400 from the backend which couldn't decode the data. ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 


     _                      _                 ____ _     ___
    / \   _ __   __ _ _   _| | __ _ _ __     / ___| |   |_ _|
   / ‚ñ≥ \ | '_ \ / _` | | | | |/ _` | '__|   | |   | |    | |
  / ___ \| | | | (_| | |_| | | (_| | |      | |___| |___ | |
 /_/   \_\_| |_|\__, |\__,_|_|\__,_|_|       \____|_____|___|
                |___/
    

Angular CLI: 11.1.0
Node: 14.15.0
OS: darwin x64

Angular: 11.1.0
... animations, cdk, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core
... forms, material, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic
... router
Ivy Workspace: Yes

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------

@angular-devkit/core            11.1.0

Issues.Body:
# üìö Docs or angular.io bug report ### Description Incorrect code in "Observable HeroService" section of Angular Tour of Heroes section "Part 4: Add services". At least, as far as I can tell it's incorrect, or at the least not very obvious. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction ### What's the affected URL?** https://angular.io/tutorial/toh-pt4#observable-heroservice ### Reproduction Steps** Follow the steps up to that point in the guide, see that this code in `hero.service.ts` is referencing a `heroes` variable that does not exist: ```ts getHeroes(): Observable { return heroes; } ``` ### Expected vs Actual Behavior** It _seems_ like the intent is to use `const heroes = of(HEROES);`, based on the docs immediately after the code snippet and the code snippets later in the page? ## üì∑Screenshot ## üî• Exception or Error

              ~~~~~

Issues.Title: fix(http): emit error on XMLHttpRequest abort event
Issues.Body:
Fixes #22324

## PR Checklist
Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit
- [x] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [ ] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)


## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

<!-- Please check the one that applies to this PR using "x". -->

- [x] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:


## What is the current behavior?
<!-- Please describe the current behavior that you are modifying, or link to a relevant issue. -->

Issue Number: #22324 

Before this change, when Google Chrome cancels a XMLHttpRequest, an Observable of the response never finishes. This happens, for example, when you put your computer to sleep or just press Ctrl+S to save the browser page.

## What is the new behavior?

After this commit, if request is canceled or aborted an appropriate Observable will be completed with an error.

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No


<!-- If this PR contains a breaking change, please describe the impact and migration path for existing applications below. -->


## Other information

I was thinking about a new HttpEventType that tracks the abort event, but it seems to me that if forces beyond your control have decided your request is no longer going to continue, it looks more like an error.

I couldn't find a way to reproduce this bug with JSONP. It appears JSONP request is not aborted.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(http): emit error on XMLHttpRequest abort event" (#40786)

Minimal Webpack JSON stat types are now used that represent the fields used by the tooling.

Issues.Title: `ng update` fails for custom schematic with "An unhandled exception occurred: Cannot find module"
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command - [ ] new - [ ] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [x] update - [ ] lint - [ ] extract-i18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: ~10.2.1 (and possibly anything less than 11.1.4) ### Description When running `ng update my-package` the process fails with the following error (full stacktrace included below): ``` An unhandled exception occurred: Cannot find module 'my-package' ``` Our package depends on Angular 10.x, so this is being run in an Angular 10 workspace. I believe this is a bug in the latest Angular CLI because: * We tested this update command when we released the new version of our schematics package on 2021-01-29 and it worked back then, but now it does not (with no changes to our package) * When running `ng update` the Angular CLI will check the version of the CLI installed locally and if it is not the latest version then it will install the latest version in a tmp dir and use that to run the update * A new version of the CLI has been released since we last saw this working, so that's the only thing that's changed * If you run `NG_DISABLE_VERSION_CHECK=1 ng update ...` to disable the ‚Äòuse latest CLI‚Äô behaviour and instead use the locally-installed v.10 of the CLI, then the migration completes successfully. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction * Create a custom schematic and publish two versions, with some migrations * Install the old version of the package containing the schematic in an Angular 10 project * Run `ng update custom-schematic-package-name` ## üî• Exception or Error 

An unhandled exception occurred: Cannot find module 'my-package'
Require stack:

Issues.Title: Problem with "Webpack 5" & "Module Federation" & "license-webpack-plugin" in Angular 11.2 & 12.0.0@next
Issues.Body:
I Created an application with `Webpack5` and  `Webpack Module Federation`. It works with **Angular 11.0.3** but with `Angular 11.2` & `12.0.0@next`  I have a problem with ` license-webpack-plugin`.

Error log:
```

[error] HookWebpackError: ENOENT: no such file or directory, open '\package.json'
    at makeWebpackError (D:\MyGit\narik-pluggable-dashboard-sample\node_modules\webpack\lib\HookWebpackError.js:49:9)
    at D:\MyGit\narik-pluggable-dashboard-sample\node_modules\webpack\lib\Compilation.js:2383:12
    at eval (eval at create (D:\MyGit\narik-pluggable-dashboard-sample\node_modules\tapable\lib\HookCodeFactory.js:33:10), <anonymous>:29:1)
    at fn (D:\MyGit\narik-pluggable-dashboard-sample\node_modules\webpack\lib\Compilation.js:373:17)
    at _next4 (eval at create (D:\MyGit\narik-pluggable-dashboard-sample\node_modules\tapable\lib\HookCodeFactory.js:33:10), <anonymous>:26:1)
    at eval (eval at create (D:\MyGit\narik-pluggable-dashboard-sample\node_modules\tapable\lib\HookCodeFactory.js:33:10), <anonymous>:45:1)
    at processTicksAndRejections (internal/process/task_queues.js:97:5)
-- inner error --
Error: ENOENT: no such file or directory, open '\package.json'
    at Object.openSync (fs.js:458:3)
    at Object.readFileSync (fs.js:360:35)
    at CacheBackend.provideSync (D:\MyGit\narik-pluggable-dashboard-sample\node_modules\webpack\node_modules\enhanced-resolve\lib\CachedInputFileSystem.js:233:32)
    at WebpackFileSystem.readFileAsUtf8 (D:\MyGit\narik-pluggable-dashboard-sample\node_modules\license-webpack-plugin\dist\WebpackFileSystem.js:52:24)
    at PluginChunkReadHandler.getPackageJson (D:\MyGit\narik-pluggable-dashboard-sample\node_modules\license-webpack-plugin\dist\PluginChunkReadHandler.js:35:43)
    at PluginChunkReadHandler.processModule (D:\MyGit\narik-pluggable-dashboard-sample\node_modules\license-webpack-plugin\dist\PluginChunkReadHandler.js:45:40)
    at D:\MyGit\narik-pluggable-dashboard-sample\node_modules\license-webpack-plugin\dist\PluginChunkReadHandler.js:29:23
    at WebpackModuleFileIterator.internalCallback (D:\MyGit\narik-pluggable-dashboard-sample\node_modules\license-webpack-plugin\dist\WebpackModuleFileIterator.js:28:13)
    at WebpackModuleFileIterator.iterateFiles (D:\MyGit\narik-pluggable-dashboard-sample\node_modules\license-webpack-plugin\dist\WebpackModuleFileIterator.js:8:9)
    at D:\MyGit\narik-pluggable-dashboard-sample\node_modules\license-webpack-plugin\dist\PluginChunkReadHandler.js:27:32
```

It seems that with Angular 11.0 Licence Extraction has been disabled,

`Warning: License extraction is currently disabled when using Webpack 5. This is temporary and will be corrected in a future update`.

but with Angular 11.2 and next, `license-webpack-plugin` cannot load `package.json` because directory has not been specified on the module.

You can find sample repo [here](https://github.com/NarikMe/narik-pluggable-dashboard-sample/tree/upgrade-to-angular-next)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Problem with "Webpack 5" & "Module Federation" & "license-webpack-plugin" in Angular 11.2 & 12.0.0@next" (#20028)

Issues.Title: [10.2.x] ci: provide names for nightly E2E jobs
Issues.Body: The CI size check uses the `e2e-cli` job to retrieve the build artifacts. But with the nightly E2E job having the same name, CircleCI named the regular E2E job `e2e-cli-1` which caused the CI size check to get stuck in a pending state.

Issues.Title: Tailwind support
Issues.Body:
@clydin few things that maybe will help you ensure full TailwindCSS support, based on issues we had in `ngneat/tailwind`:

1. Tailwind uses PurgeCSS under the hood, which is enabled when `process.env.NODE_ENV` is `production`, which Angular not setting by default.
https://tailwindcss.com/docs/optimizing-for-production#removing-unused-css
https://twitter.com/Nartc1410/status/1357504574479810568
2. Tailwind dark mode directives won't work correctly in component styles with view encapsulation other than `none`, as tailwind will just try to prepend class with `.dark`, so the result code will be something like `.dark[_ng-content-**] .value[_ng-content-**]`. Also not sure what will happen with `ShadowDom`, tested only with `emulated`. In `ngneat/tailwind` we made PostCSS plugin for it: https://github.com/vltansky/postcss-ng-tailwind-in-components. Probably there are alternative solutions.
https://github.com/ngneat/tailwind/issues/54

relevant to: https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/commit/73b409881f71a8235769a345356dcde3c568d0c3
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Tailwind support" (#20015)

Issues.Title: Remove experimental rollup pass
Issues.Body:
**refactor(@angular-devkit/build-angular): remove experimental rollup pass**

The experimental rollup pass has significant issues with the new Ivy webpack plugin. It also, didn't produce as well as we hoped in real world scenarios infact in many cases this caused build to fail.

REAKING CHANGE:

The experimental rollup pass `--experimental-rollup-pass` option has been removed.

Closes #15836

**feat(@schematics/angular): add migration to remove deprecated options from 'angular.json'**


**refactor(@ngtools/webpack): remove export of `VirtualFileSystemDecorator` type**

This was only needed for the rollup loader.

##### Notes

-   using `~` is deprecated and can be removed from your code (**we recommend it**), but we still support it for historical reasons. 

Why you can removed it?
The loader will first try to resolve `@import`/`@use` as relative, if it cannot be resolved, the loader will try to resolve `@import`/`@use` inside [`node_modules`](https://webpack.js.org/configuration/resolve/#resolve-modules).

##### ‚ö† BREAKING CHANGES

-   minimum supported `webpack` version is `5`

##### Features

-   supported the [`resolve.byDependency`](https://webpack.js.org/configuration/resolve/#resolvebydependency) option, you can setup `{ resolve: { byDependency: { sass: { mainFiles: ['custom', '...'] } } } }`

Issues.Title: bug(MatSelectionList): Non multiple selection-list returns Array
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Use StackBlitz to reproduce your issue: 
- Components: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-8izayv

Steps to reproduce:
1. Open https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-8izayv
2. Select an option;
3. Check the `FormControl.value`.
 

#### Expected Behavior

What behavior were you expecting to see?
I'd like to have the `FormControl.value` as a single value (not as `Array`), since I passed `[multiple]="false"`.

#### Actual Behavior

What behavior did you actually see?
`FormControl.value` is an `Array` even with `[multiple]="false"`.

#### Environment

- Angular: 11
- CDK/Material: 11
- Browser(s):
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu):

Issues.Title: fix(material/input): only apply styling when inside a form field
Issues.Body:
Currently `mat-form-field` brings in the styles for `MatInput`. but the problem is that they target a class that is applied even to inputs that aren't inside a form field.

These changes aim to prevent CSS from bleeding out by only styling inputs inside a `mat-form-field`.

Fixes #21871.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material/input): only apply styling when inside a form field" (#21876)

Issues.Title: bug(input): only apply MatInput styles when inside of a form-field
Issues.Body:
MatFormField` includes styles that affect the `MatInput` element inside. However, some people use `MatInput` (such as with `MatChipInput`) without `MatFormField`, meaning that the styles only apply when some other `MatFormField` appears on the page. 

We should conditionally apply the `MatInput` CSS class used for styling based on whether it actually appears inside of a `MatFormField`. We probably want to leave the existing class as-is and move the styles to a new conditional class, since that will be the _least_ breaking. This is still a potentially breaking change, though, so we'll have to see how severely this breaks apps inside of Google.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(input): only apply MatInput styles when inside of a form-field" (#21871)

Issues.Title: fix(material/core): mat-optgroup labels are read twice during screen-reader page navigation
Issues.Body:
Fixed by adding aria-hidden="true" to the <label> elements, so that while screenreaders will still announce the label text for the group (due to the aria-labelledby property on mat-optgroup), they will skip over the actual label element. Additionally, changed the label to a span to make it clear that the text is visual only and not carrying any special semantic meaning for the a11y tree.

Fixes #21857
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material/core): mat-optgroup labels are read twice during screen-reader page navigation" (#21858)

Issues.Title: bug(mat-optgroup): <label> element should be skipped during screen-reader page navigation
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

1. Go to the "Creating groups of options" demo on the [mat-select demo page](https://material.angular.io/components/select/overview#creating-groups-of-options).
2. Navigate through the mat-select with groups using a screen-reader's page navigation. 
 
#### Expected Behavior

The group label should only be read once when the screen-reader navigates through the select options. The group label itself should never get focus, but its value should be read when the user navigates into the group.  

#### Actual Behavior

ChromeVox (issue): The screen-reader will read focus the group label and read the group name twice ("Grass" followed by "Grass group")

MacOS VoiceOver + Chrome (issue): The screen-reader focuses the group as a whole and reads the group name ("Grass, group 2 of 5"). Then it progresses to the group label ("Grass") before going into the options.

Windows JAWS + Chrome (ok): The screen-reader skips the label element and reads the group label when navigating into a group of options.

#### Guidance

mat-select is a listbox widget, and per the [WAI ARIA listbox guidance](https://www.w3.org/TR/wai-aria-1.2/#listbox), listboxes should "contain children whose role is option or elements whose role is group which in turn contains children whose role is option." The `<label>` elements interfere with this pattern because they are not hidden from the a11y tree. 

We can fix this by adding `aria-hidden="true"` to the `<label>` element, so that while screenreaders will still announce the label text for the group (due to the aria-labelledby property on mat-optgroup), they will skip over the actual label element. Optionally, the `<label>` could be changed to a `<span>` to make it clear that the text is visual only and not carrying any special semantic meaning for the a11y tree.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(mat-optgroup): <label> element should be skipped during screen-reader page navigation" (#21857)

Issues.Title: fix(material/datepicker): avoid interfering with external click listener
Issues.Body:
Currently the datepicker toggle's `click` listener is on the inner `button` element and we call `stopPropagation` on it in order to prevent the form field from focusing the input. The problem is that doing so will also prevent any custom `click` handler that the user might have added to the `mat-datepicker-toggle`.

These changes resolve the issue by moving the listener directly onto the toggle host which will invoke any external listeners while still allowing us to stop its propagation.

Fixes #21836.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material/datepicker): avoid interfering with external click listener" (#21856)

Issues.Title: bug(MatTabNav): selectedIndex is undefined or incorrect on page load
Issues.Body:
Hello everyone, I'm trying to get a selectedIndex for specific navigation tab after the page loads and based on defined route (routerLinkActive directive). I tried to get the **MatTabNav** component using **@ViewChild** and to access the selectedIndex property in ngAfterViewInit or in ngAfterContentInit and I'm getting -1 (ngAfterViewInit) or 0 (ngAfterContentInit). Are you familiar with this issue and do you know how can I fix it (or some workaround) and how can I get the correct index base on the active route? I'm using navigation tabs as follows: ```
{{ tab.title }}
``` And in the wrapper navigation component: ``` @ViewChild(MatTabNav, { static: true }) navigation: MatTabNav; ngAfterContentInit(): void { console.log(this.navigation.selectedIndex); // 0 } ngAfterViewInit(): void { console.log(this.navigation.selectedIndex); // -1 } ```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(MatTabNav): selectedIndex is undefined or incorrect on page load" (#21852)
